img.p: A subsidiary nonprofit of Arizona Youth Partnership founded for the purpose of operating a charter school in Marana authorized by the Arizona State Board For Charter Schools

Open Doors Community School is a not for profit, tuition free charter school located in North Marana at Grier and Sandario. We offer small school environment for K-8 students looking for an individualized education with growth opportunities for EVERY student in a family friendly environment. We pride ourselves on the strong relationships our students have with each other, teachers and other adults in our school.

card-item cell small-2 medium-4 large-2 wow fadeIn

h4.a: Friendly FACES free after school program

div.class: card-item cell small-2 medium-4 large-2 wow fadeIn

div.p:
What makes us different?
• FREE after-school program every day that runs until 5:30pm.
• Small class sizes (1:25 teacher to student ratio)
• Commitment to close learning gaps and grow students academically
• Highly qualified, certified teachers
• Learning BEYOND standardized tests
• Special events open to students, families, and the community
• Community partnerships focused on keeping students and families strong and healthy
• Kind, bully-free campus
To equip students for academic achievement as they unlock their promise through an integrated focus on academics, life success skills, and family/community engagement

p.strong: Support Open Doors Community School by giving a tax credit!

div.p:
As a public school, Open Doors Community School is eligible to receive tax credit donations to support extracurricular activities. Tax credits are available up to $200 for an individual and $400 for a couple filing jointly. CTDS code 108512001.
Please consult your tax advisor for more information.

div.class: clearfix grid-x grid-padding-x events-holder wow fadeIn

div.p: For our 7th annual Rodeo Hoedown, come join us for food, dancing, animals, and games!

div.script: jQuery(document).ready(function($){gformInitSpinner( 8, 'https://azyp.org/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.gif' );jQuery('#gform_ajax_frame_8').on('load',function(){var contents = jQuery(this).contents().find('*').html();var is_postback = contents.indexOf('GF_AJAX_POSTBACK') >= 0;if(!is_postback){return;}var form_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_wrapper_8');var is_confirmation = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_confirmation_wrapper_8').length > 0;var is_redirect = contents.indexOf('gformRedirect(){') >= 0;var is_form = form_content.length > 0 && ! is_redirect && ! is_confirmation;var mt = parseInt(jQuery('html').css('margin-top'), 10) + parseInt(jQuery('body').css('margin-top'), 10) + 100;if(is_form){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_8').html(form_content.html());if(form_content.hasClass('gform_validation_error')){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_8').addClass('gform_validation_error');} else {jQuery('#gform_wrapper_8').removeClass('gform_validation_error');}setTimeout( function() { /* delay the scroll by 50 milliseconds to fix a bug in chrome */ jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gform_wrapper_8').offset().top - mt); }, 50 );if(window['gformInitDatepicker']) {gformInitDatepicker();}if(window['gformInitPriceFields']) {gformInitPriceFields();}var current_page = jQuery('#gform_source_page_number_8').val();gformInitSpinner( 8, 'https://azyp.org/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.gif' );jQuery(document).trigger('gform_page_loaded', [8, current_page]);window['gf_submitting_8'] = false;}else if(!is_redirect){var confirmation_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('.GF_AJAX_POSTBACK').html();if(!confirmation_content){confirmation_content = contents;}setTimeout(function(){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_8').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gf_8').offset().top - mt);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [8]);window['gf_submitting_8'] = false;}, 50);}else{jQuery('#gform_8').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger('gform_post_render', [8, current_page]);} );} );

div.p: Join us in building a better life for Arizona youth.

div.h5: Building solid foundations for youth and families
Please contact us with any questions or concerns

Tucson, AZ 85743
